codes_lines_covered: let range = std::ops::RangeInclusive::new(4, 2); // This should panic
// The following code was removed because it's no longer needed.
let range = 0..4; // Use range syntax instead of `Range::new`
assert_eq!(result.err().unwrap().downcast_ref::<&str>(), Some(&"range start index 4 out of range for slice of length 3"));
assert_eq!(result.unwrap_err().downcast_ref::<&str>(), Some(&"range start index Bound::Included(3) out of range for slice of length 3"));
assert_eq!(result.unwrap_err().downcast_ref::<&str>(), Some(&"range end index Bound::Included(2) out of range for slice of length 3"));
let range = 10..15; // Range with included start greater than length
let range = 5..=20; // Range with excluded end greater than length
let range = 5..=20; // Range with excluded end greater than length
assert_eq!(result.unwrap_err().downcast_ref::<&str>(), Some(&"range start index 5 out of range for slice of length 10"));
let range = 5..15; // End included at length, valid case
